title: d3dx9_39.dll is missing or not working, stopping me from playing?
body:
Hey there! So my old computer crashed and I'm trying to play League on this little machine now, only when I get to queue into a game, the client pulls out back to the main menu, citing that there is a problem with the listed (function? I don't even know what to call that.)

Any thoughts on how to fix this?

Thanks,

-Onwodori

replies.body: Well, it kinda means you're fucked. You did something to your DirectX 9 (DX9) installation, and now a .dll file, which is mandatory, is missing. I suggest first trying to reinstall that specific missing file, however last time I had a DX9 error I had to format and reset my entire hard drive, reinstall windows, etc... it's a pain, but you can hardly play ANY games without DX9, so I'd recommend doing the easier and less likely options first. Look for a DX9 installer first, and if that doesn't work then try installing the specific files from specific downloads..

> [{quoted}](name=Duckeroo,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=AWHlfKrY,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-11-28T04:57:59.117+0000)
>
> Well, it kinda means you're fucked. You did something to your DirectX 9 (DX9) installation, and now a .dll file, which is mandatory, is missing. I suggest first trying to reinstall that specific missing file, however last time I had a DX9 error I had to format and reset my entire hard drive, reinstall windows, etc... it's a pain, but you can hardly play ANY games without DX9, so I'd recommend doing the easier and less likely options first. Look for a DX9 installer first, and if that doesn't work then try installing the specific files from specific downloads..

Oh good, sounds fun. Thanks for the advice x.x

Try installing a fresh copy of the Directx9 files using [**this installer**](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=34429). I really hope this works, because, at some point down the troubleshooting track, an OS reinstall is necessary, as *Duckeroo* mentioned.

Let me know if this worked!
